data.title: 'Best Picture' Oscar winners list of all time
data.meta_description: Get the complete best picture winners list from the Academy Awards. Look back at all of the Oscar best picture winners since 1928 with this film list.
data.text:
The 2023 Oscars have come and gone — and made history.

“Everything Everywhere All At Once” took home the award, along with six other Oscars, in a tight race against powerhouse films including “The Fabelmans” and “The Banshees of Inisherin.” The film’s star, Michelle Yeoh, who played Evelyn Quan Wang, a Chinese-American immigrant who learns she has the ability to connect with parallel universes, became the first Asian woman to win best actress in a monumental moment.

The race for the 2024 best picture is just as competitive. Nominees include 10 acclaimed films: "American Fiction," "Anatomy of a Fall," "Barbie," "The Holdovers," "Killers of the Flower Moon," "Maestro," "Oppenheimer," "Past Lives," "Poor Things" and "The Zone of Interest."

The best picture Oscar has marked the epitome of the award-show season for 95 years — where only one film comes out on top. Read on to see all the films that have won best picture thus far.

The full list of Oscar best picture winners:

2023 - "Everything Everywhere All at Once"

2022 - "CODA"

2021 - "Nomadland"

2020 - "Parasite"

2019 - "Green Book"

2018 - "The Shape of Water"

2017 - "Moonlight"

2016 - "Spotlight"

2015 - "Birdman"

2014 - "12 Years a Slave"

2013 - "Argo"

2012 - "The Artist"

2011 - "The King's Speech"

2010 - "The Hurt Locker"

2009 - "Slumdog Millionaire"

2008 - "No Country for Old Men"

2007 - "The Departed"

2006 - "Crash"

2005 - "Million Dollar Baby"

2004 - "The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King"

2003 - "Chicago"

2002 - "A Beautiful Mind"

2001 - "Gladiator"

2000 - "American Beauty"

1999 - "Shakespeare in Love"

1998 - "Titanic"

1997 - "The English Patient"

1996 - "Braveheart"

1995 - "Forrest Gump"

1994 - "Schindler’s List"

1993 - "Unforgiven"

1992 - "The Silence of the Lambs"

1991 - "Dances With Wolves"
